ESCAPING THE TUNNEL

Especially in these monotone times, it’s too easy for us to feel as if our world is constricted, and our experiences unvarying—as if we are driving through a tunnel. In March, we created odyssee to escape that tunnel.

We started odyssee with a social challenge—50 people were asked to record their experiences, their activities and feelings for 30 days.

METHODOLOGY

Through a mobile app, participants were surveyed at random moments during the day at varying frequencies: 4 times a day, 8 times a day, or 16 times a day. Each recorded moment was an opportunity to observe a detail that may have fleeted by, unnoticed.

A record comprised of responses to the following 3 prompts:
- How are you feeling?
- In the last 10 min, what kind of activity were you doing?
- I was doing this activity because...

odyssee’s 1-month challenge took place in April 2020, an unprecedented time of self-isolation and reflection. Participants across the world were collectively experiencing the same reality in similar and different ways.

WHY DID PEOPLE PARTICIPATE?

62%

Reflect on and learn form my actions and feelings

21%

Stay mindful of what is happening at each moment

11%

Compare my experiences and learn from others

4%

Motivate myself

Activity

We categorized life's activities into two groups: Inflow and Bi-directional.

INFLOW

Inflow activities lead to effects that are primarily internal to you.

BI-DIRECTIONAL

Bi-directional activities, in addition to their internal effects, also produce a significant external effect.

Drop us a message

We take your privacy seriously, and will only use your data for the creation of visualizations as well as your personal information to contact you if needed. We respect your trust and protect your privacy, and therefore will never sell or share this data with third parties. The visualizations we will create will not reveal your identity.
